ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Classic profile of present/robust OAEs (normal outer hair cell function) combined with absent/abnormal ABR (neural dys-synchrony) and history of prematurity.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Shares behavioral symptoms like difficulty in noise, but physiological discrepancy (OAE vs ABR) confirms ANSD.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensory/Cochlear Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out by the presence of robust DPOAEs, which indicate intact cochlear mechanics.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess functional communication skills and determine the impact of auditory dys-synchrony on language development.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation identifies Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD). There is a mismatch between normal cochlear function (OAEs) and abnormal neural transmission (ABR). Behavioral thresholds indicate mild sensitivity loss, but speech detection is better than pure tone averages.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild hearing loss configuration (20-30 dB HL) with air-bone gaps absent.

tests.name: DPOAE
tests.result_summary: Robust emissions present 1-8 kHz, indicating normal outer hair cell function.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: Abnormal/Dys-synchronous at 80 dB nHL; cochlear microphonic present but neural waves absent.

tests.name: Speech Audiometry
tests.result_summary: SDT (15 dB HL) is better than PTA (25-27 dB HL); WRS not tested.

proposed_items: Trial of personal FM/DM system to improve signal-to-noise ratio in educational and social settings.
Consider trial of low-gain hearing aids if behavioral thresholds remain stable and functional benefit is observed.
Referral for auditory-verbal therapy or speech-language therapy focusing on listening skills.
Regular monitoring of behavioral hearing thresholds.
counseling_actions: Explain the diagnosis of ANSD: the 'microphone' (ear) works, but the 'wire' (nerve) to the brain has a connection problem.
Discuss that sound is likely audible but distorted, making speech understanding difficult, especially in noise.
Emphasize the importance of visual cues and reducing background noise for communication.
Review the variable nature of ANSD and the need for a multidisciplinary approach.

red_flags_present: History of prematurity and NICU stay
Inconsistent response to sound (hears some things, ignores others)

escalation.rationale_short: Medical clearance/imaging and functional communication intervention are required for ANSD management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor behavioral thresholds for fluctuation and assess progress with any trial amplification or FM systems.

expected_outcome: Confirmation of ANSD diagnosis via medical imaging or genetics if applicable.
Improved communication access through FM systems or hearing aids.
Ongoing speech-language support to address developmental delays.
